workout_title: Back Width and Biceps Peak Builder

warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles, gradually increasing the size. Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds each direction.
Reach one arm overhead and lean to the opposite side, alternating sides. Perform 2 sets of 10 reps per side.
Extend arms behind you and interlock fingers, gently lifting arms to stretch the biceps. Hold for 15 seconds, 2 sets.

exercises.setup: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
execution: 1. Grip the bar with a wide grip, palms facing forward.
2. Sit with your back straight and feet flat on the floor.
3. Pull the bar down towards your upper chest, keeping your elbows pointed down and back.
4. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
5. Slowly return the bar to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.weight: Select a weight where the last 2-3 reps feel challenging but still allow you to maintain proper form.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit at the lat pull-down machine with a neutral grip attachment.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Grip the handles with palms facing each other.
2. Pull the handles down towards your chest, keeping elbows close to your body.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom.
4. Slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Choose a weight that allows you to perform 8-12 reps with proper form, ensuring the last few reps are challenging.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on engaging your lats by imagining pulling your elbows down to your sides.

exercises.setup: Use a preacher bench to angle your upper arm.
execution: 1. Sit on the preacher bench and place your upper arms on the pad.
2. Grip the bar with an underhand grip, shoulder-width apart.
3. Curl the bar towards your shoulders, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position, maintaining tension.
exercises.weight: Use a weight that allows you to perform 8-12 reps with controlled form, reaching near failure on the last rep.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit on an incline bench with dumbbells in each hand.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Lean back on the incline bench with arms hanging down.
2. Curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, keeping elbows close to your body.
3. Squeeze your biceps at the top.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that challenges you for 8-12 reps, ensuring a full range of motion and control.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on keeping your elbows locked in place to maximize tension on the biceps.
